ai-ud8.5:19.2_0: “Now it may happen, Ānanda, that others may give rise to some regret for Cunda the smith:
ai-ud8.5:19.3_0: ‘It’s your loss, friend Cunda, it’s your misfortune, in that the Realized One became fully extinguished after eating his last meal from you.’
ai-ud8.5:19.4_0: You should get rid of remorse in Cunda the smith like this:
ai-ud8.5:20.1_0: ‘You’re fortunate, friend Cunda, you’re so very fortunate, in that the Realized One became fully extinguished after eating his last meal from you.
ai-ud8.5:20.2_0: I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha.
ai-ud8.5:20.3_0: There are two meal offerings that have identical fruit and result, and are more fruitful and beneficial than other meal offerings.
ai-ud8.5:20.4_0: What are the teachings grouped by two?
ai-ud8.5:20.5_0: The meal after eating which a Realized One understands the supreme perfect awakening; and the meal after eating which he becomes fully extinguished through the natural principle of extinguishment, without anything left over.
ai-ud8.5:20.6_0: These two meal offerings have identical fruit and result, and are more fruitful and beneficial than other meal offerings.
ai-ud8.5:21.1_0: You’ve accumulated a deed that leads to long life, beauty, happiness, fame, heaven, and sovereignty.’
ai-ud8.5:21.2_0: You should dispel remorse in Cunda the smith like this.”
